alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jefferson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:47AM CDT until June 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLAIBORNE...NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN...EASTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND WESTERN COPIAH COUNTIES... At 446 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Carpenter to near Barlow, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Barlow and Carpenter around 450 AM CDT. Dentville around 455 AM CDT. Glancy around 500 AM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Southwest Mississippi. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
